A bit confusing but a ton of fun

Best shooter game I have ever played. I recently played this game in 2020, and its better playing this game late than never.

You need to work around a collapsing world fighting off aliens, while scavenging weapons of others and finding health chargers to re charge your health. Each level is well designed, with logical thinking gone behind it where you must think smart to survive. The storytelling of the game is immersive and really puts you into the shoes of the character.

To simply put it, the game is a masterpiece and revolutionises the entire genre, even to this day. The graphics definitely have not aged well, but nevertheless, this game is a must play!!
This is one of the best games on Steam
I enjoyed this game way more than I thought I would. (I played this on Sven, that's why it looks like I have almost no time in this game.)

100% recommended, graphic is great for a 20 years old game, cool mechanics, great movements, fun puzzle, kinda scary if you are under 10 years of age. 1 of the best game/easier for speedrun if you are into it.

This game is a classic and one of the best games I have ever played. The fact that you can create and download mods for this is great because you can make your own experience with the same engine. 10/10
Good game, not for anyone who grew up on fortnite.

At the time of this review, I haven't quite beat the game yet, still having some more story left. What I've played so far is nothing short of amazing. Although this is obviously not as rounded and polished as HL2 since it came before, you can see the heart put into this game. It really immerses you in the Half Life universe and makes you want to keep going to see this through. Would easily recommend to anyone who has had an interest in the Half Life series.


EDIT: 20 hours in and I have completed what paved the way for the legendary company that Valve truly is. What a remarkable time. Story was superb, gameplay was fun and active, seriously no complaints here. And that ending, chilling as hell... Doctor Freeman...
Amazing Game! Even Before 2000 Valve Was AMAZING! PLAY IT!! NOW!!

So far, I absolutely love this game. But currently I cannot progress forward because of an elevator in Xen that does not work. I have tried closing out of the game and Steam, and loading an earlier save but neither have worked. Generally the game is glitchy so I hope this is only a temporary issue that will fix its self. For everyone who is interested in getting this game, I'd say it is worth the purchase but just be aware that the game has plenty of glitches most of them being harmless.

I have a lot to say about this game, but I'll start off with: 
-
Interesting and deep story line + many fire fights and some puzzle elements = Very fun even for a first game by Valve. (For those who didn't know, Half-Life is the first game Valve ever made) And to people who are confused as to which version of this game to buy if you haven't played already, get this 1998 release version. Half-Life Source is only VISUALLY better. The source version has some more game breaking bugs than the original 98 release which is disappointing and can at times ruin the experience if you're not aware of it while playing. Not to say this version is perfectly bug free, but it's the best stable version there is.
-
Side note: Most people must have at least *heard* of Half-Life. Who doesn't know about Gordon Freeman and his trusty Crowbar? He is an iconic character to me. Idk about you but even though he's a silent protag, the game gets the messages across mostly well.
-
This game in my personal opinion is great for those who are into first person shooters, and like solving some puzzles on the side. Because there's some sections where you can get stuck if you're either not paying attention or are not careful. I've gotten stuck plenty of times trust me. Overall, I'd say experience Half-Life if you haven't already.

This game is terrible! Terribly underappreciated! This hidden gem from 1998 has gone under the radar for far too long! This game was ahead of its time and its a shame that no one appreciated it at its time of release. Hope we can see the devs come back for a sequel!
